other_tests.findings: Sinus rhythm at 60 beats per minute; ST-segment elevation of 2 to 3 mm in inferior leads (II, III, aVF) and leads V3 through V6; ST-segment depression with T-wave inversion in leads aVL, V1, and V2.
Thrombotic occlusion in the middle-through-distal portions of the right coronary artery; acute occlusion of the middle portion of the LAD artery in the area of the previous bare-metal stent.
Cooling was started after the initial neurologic examination showed unresponsiveness to verbal and painful stimuli.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After cooling, the patient was able to follow simple commands, open eyes spontaneously, and respond to verbal and tactile stimuli.

other_tests.findings: Evidence of moderate-to-large incomplete anterior, anteroseptal, and anterolateral infarction associated with moderate ischemia and hypokinesis.

other_tests.date: Before the patient's first hospital discharge to rehabilitation, Not specified
other_tests.changes_over_time: Ejection fraction declined to 34% during a subsequent admission but improved to 43% after treatment.
